isis.stitle: VT 365 Diesel Engine - 2004 Model Year - CYLINDER HEAD AND VALVE TRAIN - Cleaning, Inspection, and Testing - Valves

step1.para: Remove all carbon from valve stems and heads, using a wire brush.
Inspect each valve. Replace valves having burn marks, warping, scuffing, bending or valve tip spalling.

Measure each valve stem diameter for wear using a 0-1 inch micrometer. Measure valves at three locations 90° apart. See Specifications . Replace valves that exceed the specification for minimum stem diameter.

note.para: The intake valve has a larger diameter head.

step1.para: Use a dial caliper to measure valve face margin at four locations (90° apart)

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, minimum valve face margin must be maintained across the entire valve face. An insufficient margin will not provide correct heat dissipation and lead to valve warping or breakage. Intake and exhaust valve margins are different. Replace valve, if the margin is less than specified minimum. See Specifications .

note.para: If valves and seats are serviceable, they may be refaced to specified angles .
